intro: Murdannia wightii, commonly known as the Indian mouse-ear, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the family Commelinaceae. It is native to parts of South and Southeast Asia, including India, Sri Lanka, and Indonesia. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. It features small, lance-shaped leaves and produces tiny, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in clusters. Murdannia wightii is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
